results.title: Low back pain
results.brief_description: Looks at the subject of low back pain and injuries. Discusses causes, including lack of exercise and tension and treatment, which includes relaxation and appropriate exercise.

results.title: Love Della
results.brief_description: This is a 50’s home movie style portrait of a fictional 19 year old, undiscovered jazz starlet, called Della Ray ( Kate Cebrano).Though recently shot, the film masquerades convincingly as found footage of a 50’s jazz club and its inhabitants. It begins with a roller coaster jam session featuring unknown local musicians of 1958, and ends with an impromptu number by the delightful Delia herself, who “died” in the tradition of thejazz greats, shortly after the footage was shot. Features excellent original 50’s jazz numbers.

results.title: Lost highways: the roadside photography of Richard Szymczuk
results.brief_description: A fascinating look into the world of Australian photographer Richard Szymczuk and his passion for the urban/industrial landscape of Geelong and its surrounding environs. Since 1987 Richard has been on a mission photographing old rundown servos, milkbars, general stores, billboards, factories, recording history before it literally disappears or is replaced. His photographs have become an art form of social expression and reflect today’s society of economic rationalism. In the film Richard talks about his background, his work and his philosophy on life reflecting on the ever-changing landscape as evidenced by the many examples of his photographic works and his revisits to some of the original locales that feature throughout the documentary. Photographed by Simon Anderson with Simon Kirby and music by Steven Baker.

results.title: Lore of the land
results.brief_description: This CD-ROM was created with assistance from the Cinemedia Mutlimedia 21 Fund by Fraynework Multimedia, a not-for-profit website, video and multimedia production house established by the Sisters of Mercy, Melbourne Congregation. The work is a documentary and interactive exploration of issues of identity, belonging and reconciliation in Australia. It names the land as that which settlers and indigenous peoples share in common, both as a physical resource and as a symbolic mediator of the spiritual. The user is taken on an interactive journey of discovery structured around five areas: Experience, Indigienous Culture, Land Issues, Understanding and Discovery. Content includes a detailed timeline dating back 60,000 years, summary and analysis of legal judgments, interviews, songs and paintings. The Discovery ‘pathway’ is a game where participants travel through the landscape collecting icons and artefacts. The CD-ROM has a linked website and encourages users to keep a journal of their thoughts but can be run without these components.

results.title: Looking at the wild
results.brief_description: Harry Butler shows aspiring naturalists some of the simpler but fundamental techniques necessary to enjoy more fully a natural bush environment. Harry comments on the dress and basic equipment; demonstrates simple pit-traps and more complex fauna traps; and stresses the need for interest and enquiry in the natural bush environment.

results.title: Looking at Leeuwin
results.creator_credit: Australia. Navy Office. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Royal Australian Navy’s Junior Recruit Training establishment HMAS Leeuwin at Fremantle in Western Australia. Shows junior recruits at academic and practical classes, on board a Navy destroyer and at sport and play. Discusses further opportunities for junior recruits after their graduation.

results.title: Looking at children's movements (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The study of movement in human beings is beginning to be treated scientifically, and a study is being made of infants from birth. It seems likely that predictions can be made from the study of an infant’s movements about his or her attitudes and character throughout life. Contains b&w sequences.
